title: Resolving Tangling in Multi-Conformer Refinement via Iterative Projections
summary: This paper addresses the challenge of extracting cooperative motions from temporally and spatially averaged electron density maps in structural biology. It proposes a method to resolve the tangling phenomenon in multi-conformer refinement, which is crucial for handling conformational heterogeneity.
usefulness_reason: The paper explicitly mentions 'temporally and spatially averaged electron density maps' and 'protein dynamics', which directly relates to spatio-temporal aspects. While it doesn't mention point processes or survey data, the focus on dynamic structural data makes it relevant to spatio-temporal analysis.
